intro: Hibbertia reidii, commonly known as Reid's hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with prominent yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Hibbertia reidii has narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that splits open to release seeds. It is a relatively small shrub, usually reaching heights of up to 1 meter.
